Uses of Class
fileSystems.Path

  • Packages that use Path 
    Package Description
    fileSystems  

    • Uses of Path in fileSystems

      Methods in fileSystems that return Path 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Path Path.clone()
      Return a copy of the path.
      Path Path.combine​(Path path)
      Combine the path name path into the original path.
      static Path Path.makeFullPath​(FileSystem fs, java.lang.String path)
      Distinguish whether the input path is a global path, and make return a new global path if not.
      Path PathStack.pop()
      Pop the last element from the stack.
      Methods in fileSystems with parameters of type Path 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void SavedFileSystem.addDirectory​(Path path, Directory directory)
      Add a directory and its path to directories.
      void SavedFileSystem.addFile​(Path path, File file)
      Add a file with its path and data into files.
      void SavedFileSystem.addPath​(Path path)
      Add a path to pathStack.
      Path Path.combine​(Path path)
      Combine the path name path into the original path.
      void Directory.copyInto​(Path parentPath, Path target, FileSystem fs)
      A recursive method that copies the elements in this directory to the target.
      void File.copyTo​(Path path, FileSystem fs)
      Add a copy of this file to the target path.
      boolean FileSystem.createDirRelative​(Path path, java.lang.String dest)
      Create a new directory in the relative path.
      boolean FileSystem.createDirWhole​(Path path, java.lang.String dest)
      Create a new directory in the global path.
      boolean FileSystem.echoToFileRelative​(Path path, java.lang.String nameIn, java.lang.String dataIn, boolean append)
      If append is true, append dataIn to the data stored in the file nameIn in the relative path, create a new file and add the data if such file doesn't exist.
      boolean FileSystem.echoToFileWhole​(Path path, java.lang.String nameIn, java.lang.String dataIn, boolean append)
      If append is true, append dataIn to the data stored in the file nameIn in the global path, create a new file and add the data if such file doesn't exist.
      Directory FileSystem.findRelativeDirectory​(Path path)
      File the directory at the relative path.
      Directory FileSystem.findWholeDirectory​(Path path)
      File the directory at the global path.
      java.lang.String FileSystem.getFileInfoRelative​(Path path, java.lang.String nameIn)
      Return the data stored in the file under the relative path.
      java.lang.String FileSystem.getFileInfoWhole​(Path path, java.lang.String nameIn)
      Return the data stored in the file under the global path.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> FileSystem.getGlobalList​(Path path)
      Return the files and folder contained in the path.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> FileSystem.getRelativeList​(Path path)
      Return the files and folder contained in the path.
      static boolean SystemNavigator.isParentOf​(Path parent, Path child, FileSystem fs)
      Check if path parent contains path child.
      boolean FileSystem.isValidRelativePath​(Path path)
      Check if the relative path is a valid path.
      boolean FileSystem.isValidWholePath​(Path path)
      Check if the global path is a valid path.
      static boolean SystemNavigator.moveItemTo​(FileSystem fs, Path from, Path towards, boolean isFile)
      Move the item in the path from to the path towards.
      boolean FileSystem.navigateRelative​(Path path)
      Navigate to a relative path not in the current directory.
      void PathStack.push​(Path path)
      Push a new path to the end of the stack.
      void Directory.saveInto​(Path parentPath, SavedFileSystem saveTarget)
      A recursive method that saves a tree of files and directories into the saveTarget.
